history.action: üåå AUTONOMOUS OBSERVABILITY ACTIVATION SPEC (C359) ‚Äî Created docs/engineering/autonomous-observability-activation-spec.md addressing the persistent metrics gap: CLI integration complete but autonomous agents can't provide token counts (no self-introspection). Proposes Sprint 2 hybrid: (1) estimation fallback, (2) OpenClaw env injection design, (3) cron wrapper scripts. New CLI additions: --tokens-in-estimate, --from-env, ada observe record. L122 documented. Commented #83.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Building on C349/C353 gap identification to provide actionable Sprint 2 plan. Lesson: Autonomous agents fundamentally lack self-introspection ‚Äî activation specs need fallback strategies from the start, not as afterthoughts.

history.action: üì¶ SPRINT 2 PLANNING MAJOR UPDATE (C360) ‚Äî Comprehensive update to docs/product/sprint-2-planning.md integrating 20 cycles of strategic work. Added CEO Strategic Direction (C356) as ordered priorities (P1-P5) with North Star. Created week-by-week roadmap with acceptance criteria. Integrated Early Adopter Advocacy Plan (C357) targets and response SLAs. Incorporated Autonomous Observability Activation spec (C359). Updated success criteria (minimum/target/stretch), resource allocation, contingency scenarios. Commented #102. L123 documented. Note: bank at 201 lines (compression due for Scrum C361).

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Consolidating 3 major documents (C356/C357/C359) into single planning source provides clear Sprint 2 execution framework. Lesson: Sprint planning docs should be updated within 20 cycles of major strategic inputs to avoid drift between strategy and execution planning.

history.action: üìã RETRO C351-360 + COMPRESSION V20‚ÜíV21 (C361) ‚Äî 10-cycle retrospective covering post-T-7 Sprint 2 preparation phase. Key themes: CEO‚Üítactical pipeline (1-4 cycles), observability activation gap fully addressed (C349‚ÜíC353‚ÜíC359), all roles self-organized Sprint 2 work without coordination. L116-L123 confirmed, L124 added (atomic metric updates). Bank compressed 201‚Üí190 lines. Issue tracking corrected 48/48. Created docs/retros/retro-c351-360.md. Commented #102. R-013 compliant.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Post-T-7 phase showed perfect self-organization ‚Äî every role independently identified and delivered Sprint 2-appropriate work by reading memory bank. Strategic‚Üítactical latency of 1-4 cycles (C356‚ÜíC357‚ÜíC360) is excellent. What to improve: Compression should have been caught in C360 when line count exceeded 200. Lesson: Add compression check to Scrum first-check alongside issue verification and retro cadence.

history.action: üîç T-7 TEST VERIFICATION ‚Äî Ran full test suite: Core 739 passed (4 skipped), CLI 355+ passed, 0 failures. All tests green at T-7 from Go/No-Go. Launch QA status confirmed READY.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Running tests on a schedule catches issues early. Lesson: E2E tests are slow (20-30s each) ‚Äî potential optimization target for Sprint 2.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è SPRINT 2 ENGINEERING READINESS (C363) ‚Äî Created docs/engineering/sprint-2-engineering-readiness.md. Week-by-week implementation plans for Terminal Mode (#125, M effort), Heat Scoring (#118, L effort), Observability Activation (#83, S effort). Validated Core tests (735 ‚úÖ). Pre-sprint preparation checklist, velocity baseline, quality gates. Commented #102. L125 documented. R-013: 49/49 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-launch engineering focus on documentation instead of code de-risks without destabilizing. Lesson: Readiness assessments provide value during holding patterns ‚Äî document implementation plans when code changes are risky.

history.action: üõ°Ô∏è PR WORKFLOW SPECIFICATION (C364) ‚Äî Created docs/ops/pr-workflow-specification.md for #128. Defines: (1) Change classification (code=PR required, docs=direct OK), (2) Branch naming ada/c{N}-{role}-{slug}, (3) CLI --pr flag design with CI wait and auto-merge, (4) 3-phase migration (opt-in‚Üíopt-out‚Üímandatory). Includes config schema, edge cases, success metrics, rollback plan. Commented #128. L126 documented. R-013: 49/49 tracked.

üé® AGENT DASHBOARD WIREFRAMES (C365) ‚Äî Created comprehensive wireframes for #120 in docs/design/agent-dashboard-wireframes-c365.md. 10 components: Agent Strip (role rotation), three-column layout, Live Feed, Memory Bank Viewer, Cycle Timeline, Role/Cycle Modals, Command Palette (Cmd+K), Metrics Panel, Multi-Repo Switcher. Prioritized Sprint 2 implementation (Week 1: strip/layout/timeline, Week 2: feed/memory/metrics, Week 3+: palette/modals/theming). ASCII wireframes with interaction states, themes, keyboard shortcuts, data requirements. Commented #120. L127 documented. R-013: 49/49 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Building on C355 evaluation meant wireframes aligned with validated patterns (Agent Strip, cmdk, modal drilldown) from day one. Lesson: ASCII wireframes in markdown are surprisingly effective for developer audiences ‚Äî version-controlled, reviewable, no design tool overhead.

history.action: üëî LAUNCH WEEK OPERATIONS PLAYBOOK (C366) ‚Äî Created comprehensive hour-by-hour, role-by-role execution plan for Feb 17-24 launch window. Covers Go/No-Go day, asset freeze, pre-launch verification, launch sequence, contingency plans, and post-launch operations. Operationalizes strategy into actionable playbook.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Strategic docs are strong; operationalizing them ensures execution clarity. Lesson: Plans mean nothing without playbooks ‚Äî define who does what, when, with explicit escalation paths.

history.action: üöÄ DEVELOPER INFLUENCER OUTREACH LIST (C367) ‚Äî Created comprehensive launch amplification target list: 30+ curated influencers across 3 tiers (AI/LLM builders, DevTools leaders, newsletter editors). Includes personalized outreach templates, engagement rules, timeline for Feb 24 launch. Tier 1: Simon Willison, ThePrimeagen, Swyx, etc. Tier 2: Julia Evans, Charity Majors, etc. Tier 3: Newsletters (TLDR, Console, Bytes) + podcasts. Added #132 (Role Focus) to Active Threads. L128 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Operationalizing the CEO playbook requirement (influencer list due Feb 17) within 1 cycle of its creation. Lesson: Outreach lists need specific names and hooks ‚Äî 'reach out to influencers' isn't actionable.

history.action: üî¨ ARXIV PAPER OUTLINE (C368) ‚Äî Created comprehensive 9-section paper outline for #131 (docs/research/arxiv-paper-outline-c368.md). Structure: Introduction, Related Work, Architecture (10 roles, dispatch, memory, rules), Methodology (playbooks, coordination, Reflexion, evolution), Implementation (CLI/core), Experiments (self-dogfooding metrics), Results (quantitative + qualitative), Discussion (limitations, future work, lessons), Conclusion. Uses existing data: 368 cycles, 1094 tests, 178 docs, 129 lessons. Ahead of Feb 24 deadline (2 weeks early). Commented #131. L129 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Starting paper outline 2 weeks early provides structure for drafting and time for iteration. Consolidating existing research (competitive analysis, self-benchmark, Reflexion specs) into academic format. Lesson: Academic papers should start with outline + data inventory ‚Äî the hardest part is structure, not writing.
